title: A5: Decouple worker startup from React component mount timing
description: Revisit worker initialization so availability is not implicitly tied to React render timing, while preserving config injection and lifecycle safety.
acceptance_criteria: Worker startup path is deterministic and documented; runtime behavior validated.
notes:
Plan: locate worker bootstrap path, identify render-tied startup coupling, and refactor to explicit lifecycle controller initialized outside React render paths; preserve config injection and stop/disconnect semantics; document deterministic startup contract before close.
Completed implementation:
- Removed React mount/unmount-managed startup and shutdown calls from WorkerInitializer.
- Kept deterministic runtime behavior by syncing API base URL into workerService on config changes.
- Preserved /sw.js registration in a dedicated side-effect effect.
- Worker startup now remains demand-driven through workerService initialize/postMessage flow rather than component lifecycle.
close_reason: Worker startup is no longer coupled to React mount timing; WorkerInitializer now only syncs apiBaseUrl and registers service worker.
